pageTitle: Allegheny Misses, Focusing on Cost Cuts - July 24, 2013 - Zacks.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {64703=At the center of everything we do is a strong commitment to independent research and sharing its profitable discoveries with investors. This dedication to giving investors a trading advantage led to the creation of our proven Zacks Rank stock-rating system. Since 1986 it has nearly tripled the S&P 500 with an average gain of +26% per year. These returns cover a period from 1986-2011 and were examined and attested by Baker Tilly, an independent accounting firm., 14868=by Zacks Equity Research   Published on July 24, 2013 |, 23179=Financial Position Allegheny ended the quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $74.1 million, down 65% year over year. Long-term debt declined roughly 29% year over year to $1,053.6 million. Total debt-to-capital ratio was 37.2% as of Jun 30, 2013, up from 36.8% as of Jun 30, 2012. Outlook, 20346=Allegheny Technologies Inc. (ATI - Analyst Report) reported second-quarter 2013 earnings of 4 cents per share, down from 50 cents recorded a year ago. The results missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 10 cents. Profit plummeted 92 % year over year to $4.4 million on lower sales., 25235=Allegheny is primarily focusing on cost optimization and is accelerating its cost reduction efforts. Allegheny, through this move, was successful in gross cost reductions of more than $79 million in during the first six months of 2013, a pace which is well ahead its 2013 target of $100 million in new cost reductions., 23543=Allegheny, which is among the prominent players in the U.S. specialty steel industry along with Carpenter Technology (CRS - Snapshot Report), and Precision Castparts (PCP - Analyst Report), expects business conditions to remain challenging through second-half 2013 due to persistent global economic uncertainties, short lead time and volatile raw material prices., 64642=Copyright © 2015 Zacks Investment Research, 25568=The cost reductions are expected to reap benefits for Allegheny in 2013 and beyond. The company also aims to reduce its managed working capital by implanting lean initiatives to improve inventory turns.}
